original: Lundberg, John Åke Olaus, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 22/7/84 i Hälsingborg av telegrafkomm. Jacob L. o. Ebba Westerberg. G. 11 m. Anna Almström. Barn: Stig-Åke f. 12, ombudsman, Sthlm, Britt-Ingar 16, fil. kand., g. m. fil. lic. Thorsten Hägerstrand, Lund. — Mog:ex. i Häl-•singb. 02, fil. kand. i Lund 05, provår i Sthlm 09-10, delt. i skolöverstyr. kurs i kemi i Upps. 21. E. o. aman. v. kem. inst. i Lund 04-05 o. 06-07, ord. dito 07-08, extralär. v. Hälsingb. gosslärov. 05, vik. adj. där 08-09 o. åter extralär. 10-11, lär. v. E. Lundb. h. flicklärov. i Hälsingb. 08-09 o. 10-11, adj. i Arvika 11, lär. v. Arvika tekn. yrkessk. 11-18, förest, där 12-18, adj. i fysik o. kemi v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 19, rektors skrivbitr. där 29-40, vik. rektor 36 o. somr. 29-40, lär. v. Lundén-ska privatsk. i Gbg 19-31, Gbgs kvinnl. folksk:sem. 22-27, Priv. h. lär:nesem. i Gbg 27-32, Gbgs gymn. f. fl. v. Sigrid Rudebecks sk. 35-43. Skolöverstyr. ombud v. realex. 24-27 o. 34-35. Var i Arvika bl. a. ordf. i styr. f. före- läsn:in’st. 15-19, stadsfullm. 17-19 samt sekr. i livsmed :styr. f. Värml. 1. västra distr. 17-18. Studiresor t. TyskL 23, Tyskl., Tjeckoslov. o. Österr. 26, Engl. m. statsstip. 32. Skr.: Hand-ledn. v. lab. i kemi på gymn. (3. uppl. 46), tills. m. G. Böös: Läroib. i kemi f. gymn. (6. uppl. 47) samt ett stort antal avh. o. upps. i tidn. o. tidskr. RVO.
translated: Lundberg, John Åke Olaus, school adjutant, Gothenburg, b. 22/7/84 in Hälsingborg to telegrapher Jacob L. and Ebba Westerberg. Married on 11 m. to Anna Almström. Children: Stig-Åke b. 12, union representative, Stockholm, Britt-Ingar 16, B.A., married to Ph.D. Thorsten Hägerstrand, Lund. - Completed exams in Häl•singb. in 1902, B.A. in Lund in 1905, probationary year in Stockholm 09-10, participated in school supervision course in chemistry in Uppsala in 1921. Assistant and assistant manager at the chemical institute in Lund from 1904-1905 and 1906-1907, regular lecturer from 1907-1908, extra teacher at Hälsingb. Boys' School in 1905, substitute adjutant there in 1908-1909 and again extra teacher from 1910-1911, teacher at E. Lundb. h. girls' school in Hälsingb. in 1908-1909 and 1910-1911, adjutant in Arvika in 1911, teacher at Arvika technical vocational school from 1911-1918, supervisor from 1912-1918, adjutant in physics and chemistry at Vasa h. a. 1. in Gothenburg since 1919, rector's secretary there from 1929-1940, substitute principal in 1936 and summers from 1929-1940, teacher at Lundén-ska private school in Gothenburg from 1919-1931, Gothenburg women's elementary school from 1922-1927, private teacher training school in Gothenburg from 1927-1932, Gothenburg gymnasium and others at Sigrid Rudebeck's school from 1935-1943. School supervision representative for realex. from 1924-1927 and 1934-1935. In Arvika, among other things, chairman of the board for the lecture institute from 1915-1919, city council member from 1917-1919, and secretary of the board for the food control in Värmland's western district from 1917-1918. Study trips to Germany in 1923, Germany, Czechoslovakia, and Austria in 1926, and England with a government scholarship in 1932. Writings: Handbook of laboratory management in chemistry at gymn. (3rd edition, 1946), co-authored with G. Böös: Chemistry teaching materials for gymn. (6th edition, 1947), as well as numerous papers and essays in journals and magazines. Knight of the Royal Vasa Order (RVO).

structured.name: John Åke Olaus Lundberg

education.description: Participated in school supervision course in chemistry in Uppsala in 1921

employmentHistory.name: E. Lundb. h. Girls' School, Hälsingborg
E. Lundb. h. Girls' School, Hälsingborg

structured.description: John Åke Olaus Lundberg was a Swedish school adjutant born on 22nd July 1884 in Hälsingborg to parents Jacob L. and Ebba Westerberg. He was married to Anna Almström and had two children named Stig-Åke and Britt-Ingar. Lundberg had a successful career in education, holding various teaching positions in different schools and institutions. He also served in different administrative roles and was involved in educational organizations. Lundberg authored several publications in the field of chemistry and received the Knight of the Royal Vasa Order (RVO) honor.
